verses.verse: O Lord, You have (Ps. 35:1; Jer. 51:36) pleaded the case for my soul; (Ps. 71:23) You have redeemed my life.
O LORD, You have seen how I am wronged; (Ps. 9:4) Judge my case.
You have seen all their vengeance, All their (Jer. 11:19) schemes against me.
You have heard their reproach, O LORD, All their schemes against me,
The lips of my enemies And their whispering against me all the day.
Look at their (Ps. 139:2) sitting down and their rising up; I am their taunting song.
(Ps. 28:4; Jer. 11:20; 2 Tim. 4:14) Repay them, O LORD, According to the work of their hands.
Give them a veiled heart; Your curse be upon them!
In Your anger, Pursue and destroy them (Deut. 25:19; Jer. 10:11) From under the heavens of the (Ps. 8:3) LORD.
The Degradation of Zion How the gold has become dim! How changed the fine gold! The stones of the sanctuary are scattered At the head of every street.
The precious sons of Zion, Valuable as fine gold, How they are regarded (Is. 30:14; Jer. 19:11; (2 Cor. 4:7)) as clay pots, The work of the hands of the potter!
Even the jackals present their breasts To nurse their young; But the daughter of my people is cruel, (Job 39:14-17) Like ostriches in the wilderness.
The tongue of the infant clings To the roof of its mouth for thirst; (Ps. 22:15) The young children ask for bread, But no one breaks it for them.
Those who ate delicacies Are desolate in the streets; Those who were brought up in scarlet (Job 24:8) Embrace ash heaps.

The punishment of the iniquity of the daughter of my people Is greater than the punishment of the (Ezek. 16:48) sin of Sodom, Which was (Gen. 19:25; Jer. 20:16) overthrown in a moment, With no hand to help her!
Her Nazirites were brighter than snow And whiter than milk; They were more ruddy in body than rubies, Like sapphire in their appearance.
Now their appearance is blacker than soot; They go unrecognized in the streets; (Job 19:20; Ps. 102:5) Their skin clings to their bones, It has become as dry as wood.
Those slain by the sword are better off Than those who die of hunger; For these (Lev. 26:39; Ezek. 24:23) pine away, Stricken for lack of the fruits of the (Jer. 16:4) field.

The hands of the (Lev. 26:29; Deut. 28:57; 2 Kin. 6:29; Jer. 19:9; Lam. 2:20; Ezek. 5:10) compassionate women Have cooked their (Is. 49:15) own children; They became (Deut. 28:57) food for them In the destruction of the daughter of my people.
The LORD has fulfilled His fury, (Jer. 7:20; Lam. 2:17; Ezek. 22:31) He has poured out His fierce anger. (Deut. 32:22; Jer. 21:14) He kindled a fire in Zion, And it has devoured its foundations.
The kings of the earth, And all inhabitants of the world, Would not have believed That the adversary and the enemy Could (Jer. 21:13) enter the gates of Jerusalemâ€”
(Jer. 5:31; Ezek. 22:26, 28; Zeph. 3:4) Because of the sins of her prophets And the iniquities of her priests, (Jer. 2:30; 26:8, 9; Matt. 23:31) Who shed in her midst The blood of the just.
